Example of a bot.json file#

Below is a sample code of the bot.json file.#

Attention

In order for the bot to work correctly, you need to fill in all the fields of the file.

 1{
 2    "BOT_TOKEN": "NUM_STR_TYPE",
 3    "update_id": "INT-FLOAT_TYPE",
 4    "business_connection": {
 5        "id": "STR_TYPE",
 6        "user": {
 7            "id": "INT-FLOAT_TYPE",
 8            "is_bot": "BOOL_STR_TYPE",
 9            "first_name": "STR_TYPE",
10            "last_name": "STR_TYPE",
11            "username": "STR_TYPE",
12            "language_code": "STR_TYPE",
13            "is_premium": "BOOL_STR_TYPE"
14        },
15        "user_chat_id": "INT_TYPE",
16        "date": "INT-FLOAT_TYPE",
17        "can_reply": "BOOL_STR_TYPE",
18        "is_enabled": "BOOL_STR_TYPE"
19    },
20    "GIGACHAT": {
21        "TOKEN": "STR_TYPE",
22        "AUTH_TOKEN": "STR_TYPE",
23        "ANSWER_SETTING": {
24            "TEMPERATURE": "INT-FLOAT_TYPE",
25            "TOP_P": "INT-FLOAT_TYPE",
26            "N": "INT-FLOAT_TYPE"
27        }
28    },
29    "MYSQL": {
30        "HOST": "STR_TYPE",
31        "USERNAME": "STR_TYPE",
32        "PASSWORD": "STR_TYPE",
